column1: # Web content included in this report (Data table)
# Page Views - counts of the number of web pages viewed (content consumed). Includes reloads and user’s clicks of the back button.
# Visits - counts of the number of continuous browsing sessions (people), without a break of greater than 30 minutes.
# Unique Visitors - the number of unique individuals who have visited the site during a specified time period.
# Page Views - counts of the number of web pages viewed (content consumed). Includes reloads and user’s clicks of the back button.
# Visits - counts of the number of continuous browsing sessions (people), without a break of greater than 30 minutes.
# Unique Visitors - the number of unique individuals who have visited the site during a specified time period.
# Bounce Rate - The number of bounces divided by the number of site entries.
# Visits - counts of the number of continuous browsing sessions (people), without a break of greater than 30 minutes.
# Unique Visitors - the number of unique individuals who have visited the site during a specified time period.
# Entry Rate - Percentage of visits that entered on this page. Calculated as Entries ÷ Visits.
# Exit Rate - Percentage of visits that exited on this page. Calculated as Exits ÷ Visits.

# Average Time Spent on Site - The average amount of time spent on this page. Note: This metric is not 100% accurate, as exits and bounces would not be factored into the calculation (because there is no server call sent to Adobe when someone exits).

# Exit Rate - Percentage of visits that exited on this page. Calculated as Exits ÷ Visits.

# The device (mobile / desktop / tablet) that a visitor uses to visit your site.
# Referrer Types categorize the sources of traffic to your web content.
# Other Websites: This tends to be primarily our site. Others are 3rd party websites that are neither social networks nor search engines
# Typed/Bookmarked is traffic that has no referring web page.  Examples are a link in an email, a visitor's bookmark or typed directly into the browser address bar.
# Search Engines: commercial search engines like Google, Bing, etc.
# Hard drive: Referrer originated from a local copy of a web page on the visitor’s hard drive.
# The ‘Visit depth’ dimension reports the number of page views the visitor saw in the entire visit.
# The dimension item of "Pages per visit: 1" represents a single-page visit, while the dimension item "Pages per visit: 8" represents a visit with 8 page views
# Visits - counts of the number of continuous browsing sessions (people), without a break of greater than 30 minutes.
# Page Views - counts of the number of web pages viewed (content consumed). Includes reloads and user’s clicks of the back button.
# Unique Visitors - the number of unique individuals who have visited the site during a specified time period.
